subject: RE: [junit] Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework)
msgSnippet: ... As I already wrote to Cedric, this sounds a lot like Parameterized TestCase . You might want to google for it. ... OK. ... How do you run the tests? From
messageBody:
> I created a constructor that take 3 parameteres and remove the generic
> (no-args) constructor, but it seems that JUnit requires the
> generic constructor no matter what.
>
> I tried to create a test suite that calls my own constructor.
> suite.addTest(new tester("testPositive", inputFile, outputFile);

As I already wrote to Cedric, this sounds a lot like "Parameterized
TestCase". You might want to google for it.

> When I debug my code, I saw that JUnit calls my constructor,
> and added the object into the suite.

OK.

> However, when it runs
> the test case, it try to re-create the object again by
> calling generic constructor with no-args or one arguments.

How do you run the tests? From which code exactly does the generic
constructor get called?

Cheers, Ilja
